TopicTitle: "Warp to maneuver" button on navball maneuver indicator.

Articles.Content:
I've been doing a lot of solo missions, and therefore have not needed Kerbal Alarm Clock, for most of 1.6.x. Therefore, I've been using the stock "warp to maneuver node" ability in map mode.

For times when I'm not in map mode, or can't easily see/determine what part of the orbit is after the maneuver node but still in the correct SOI, I'd love a "warp to" button on the navball itself. I suggest putting it on the dV indicator, as in this poorly made mockup.

If you support this please also +1 it on the bug tracker: https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/21006

EDIT: At some point in the future (possibly recent past?), SQUAD will go through a process to select projects for 1.7, 1.8, etc. This may consist of a team meeting or of one senior dev/manager drawing up a list, but either way they will probably draw from a combination of internal TODO items and user feedback. The goal then is to get noticed during that process. A forum thread by itself will show up at the top of the list for a day or two, then fade into obscurity after it drops off the first page. A bug tracker entry by contrast is persistent, and if has a lot of upvotes, it will easily float toward the top of the list.

This thread's OP is actually an excellent example of how to use both effectively. A feedback entry on the tracker to record the request formally, collect votes, and conduct strictly relevant discussions. A forum thread to attract attention, build support, and direct it to the place where it can make a difference (as well as conducting random irrelevant discussion like you're reading right now). Kudos to @5thHorseman for that.
